page.title: 10SOCIAL LIFE IN DRUMOAK
page.content: Although Drumoak is a small place there is quite a lot of social activity and forms of recreation for all ages. On the second Monday of every month there is a meeting of the Women's Rural Institute in the village hall. The hall is also used by bowling and badminton clubs for adults every week. On Tuesdays and Thursdays a Pre School Playgroup for 3 - 5 year olds meets in the mornings. Cubs and Scouts meet every Friday evening in the hall and after they are finished a Bingo Club meets weekly. Every February there is a community Dinner Dance which is very popular. Groups like the school, playgroup, hall committee hold social activities. The local Pub, the Irvine Arms, is open seven days a week.
